newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuania deputies okay State Commercial Bank plan.
newsitem.headline: Lithuania deputies okay State Commercial Bank plan.

text.p: Lithuania's parliament on Thursday approved a plan to restructure and support the country's third largest bank, the state-owned State Commercial Bank.

A plan to issue 90 million litas of state securities to support the bank's liquidity and for the government to take full control of the bank was approved by 60 votes versus 40 against, the parliament's press service said.
State Commercial Bank's losses totalled 104 million litas in the first half of the year, with assets falling to 353 million litas from 733 million litas during the same period.
The bank's bad loans were estimated at 33 percent, or 300 million litas, of the total loan portfolio.
The government is expected to privatise the bank once its problems have been sorted out.
Local commercial banks have objected to some aspects of the plan to save the bank because it would involve transferring state accounts to the State Commercial Bank from other banks.

State Commercial Bank's problems follow a banking crisis late last year that closed the country's top commercial bank, Innovation Bank, which the government also plans to restructure as part of an industry shake up.
